API > GameObjects > Sprite

Phaser.GameObjects.Sprite

Extends: Phaser.GameObjects.GameObject

Description

A Sprite Game Object is used to display a texture on screen. Sprites can have input events and physics bodies. They can also be tweened, tinted, and have custom blend modes.

The main difference between a Sprite and an Image Game Object is that you cannot animate Images. As such, Sprites take a fraction more memory and processing time than Images.

Constructor

new Sprite(scene, x, y, texture, frame)

Parameters

Name Type Description
scene Phaser.Scene The Scene to which this Game Object belongs.
x number The horizontal position of this Game Object in the world.
y number The vertical position of this Game Object in the world.
texture string The key of the Texture this Game Object will use to render with.
frame string | number An optional frame from the Texture this Game Object is rendering with.

Methods

setTexture

setTexture(key, frame) → {Phaser.GameObjects.Sprite}

Sets the texture and frame this Game Object will use to render with.

Parameters

  • key (string) - The key of the texture to be used.
  • frame (string | number) - The name or index of the frame within the Texture.

Returns

This Game Object instance.

setPosition

setPosition(x, y, z, w) → {Phaser.GameObjects.Sprite}

Sets the position of this Game Object.

Parameters

  • x (number) - The x position of this Game Object.
  • y (number) - The y position of this Game Object.
  • z (number) - The z position of this Game Object.
  • w (number) - The w position of this Game Object.

play

play(key, ignoreIfPlaying) → {Phaser.GameObjects.Sprite}

Plays an Animation.

Parameters

  • key (string) - The string-based key of the animation to play.
  • ignoreIfPlaying (boolean) - If an animation is already playing then ignore this call.

Properties

x

number

The x position of this Game Object.

y

number

The y position of this Game Object.

texture

Phaser.Textures.Texture

The Texture this Game Object is using to render with.

frame

Phaser.Textures.Frame

The Texture Frame this Game Object is using to render with.

Examples

Basic Sprite Creation


// Create a sprite at position (100, 100) using the 'player' texture
const sprite = this.add.sprite(100, 100, 'player');

// Set the scale
sprite.setScale(2);

// Set the origin to center
sprite.setOrigin(0.5, 0.5);

Animated Sprite


// Create an animated sprite
const animatedSprite = this.add.sprite(200, 200, 'character');

// Create animation
this.anims.create({
    key: 'walk',
    frames: this.anims.generateFrameNumbers('character', { start: 0, end: 3 }),
    frameRate: 10,
    repeat: -1
});

// Play the animation
animatedSprite.play('walk');

Interactive Sprite


// Create an interactive sprite
const button = this.add.sprite(300, 300, 'button');
button.setInteractive();

// Add click handler
button.on('pointerdown', function() {
    this.setTint(0xff0000);
});

// Add hover effects
button.on('pointerover', function() {
    this.setScale(1.1);
});

button.on('pointerout', function() {
    this.setScale(1.0);
    this.clearTint();
});
